e4: While there may be initial disruption to investors who are not aware of the change, I believe that switching to the new policy would ultimately benefit ABC by fostering trust and credibility. The company's willingness to provide accurate information could also help prevent future legal issues or investigations. Moreover, with the CFO's acknowledgement of the potential market reaction being minimal, there is reason to believe that shareholders and investors will eventually adapt to the change.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize truthfulness and accuracy, providing investors and stakeholders with reliable financial information. It should also be transparent, clearly communicating any methodological choices or assumptions made in calculating earnings. Additionally, an ethical policy would avoid intentionally misleading or deceiving investors, ensuring that reported numbers reflect the company's actual performance. Furthermore, it should consider the potential impact on all stakeholders, including those who may be disadvantaged by changes to the reporting methodology.
e6: Yes. I would ask the management team to provide data on how frequently investors who are not aware of the change adjust earnings downward, compared to those who do adjust for the bias.
